      • readOnly

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder readOnly()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Enables read-only mode on this transaction.

        Transactions in read-only mode will refuse any modifying operations, such as ChronoDBTransaction.put(String, Object) or ChronoDBTransaction.remove(String).

        Specified by:
        readOnly in interface ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Returns:
        The builder (this) for method chaining. Never null.

      • threadSafe

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder threadSafe()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Enables thread-safety on this transaction.

        Please note that ChronoDB is capable of handling concurrent transactions. This setting only controls how one single transaction behaves under concurrent access. By default, one transaction is intended for one thread and thus not thread-safe. This method enables a thread-safe mode for a single transaction, which synchronizes the internal state appropriately. Do not use this unless it is absolutely required, as performance on non-thread-safe transactions is likely better than on thread-safe ones.

        Specified by:
        threadSafe in interface ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Returns:
        The builder (this) for method chaining. Never null.

      • atDate

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder atDate(java.util.Date date)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Sets up the transaction to read the contents of the ChronoDB instance at the given date.

        Please note that this method writes to the same internal value as ChronoDBTransactionBuilder.atTimestamp(long). They are semantically equivalent. The last write access to occur before ChronoDBTransactionBuilder.build() wins.

        Specified by:
        atDate in interface ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Parameters:
        date - The date to use for the read timestamp. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The builder (this) for method chaining. Never null.

      • atTimestamp

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder atTimestamp(long timestamp)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Sets up the transaction to read the contents of the ChronoDB instance at the given timestamp.

        Please note that this method writes to the same internal value as ChronoDBTransactionBuilder.atDate(Date). They are semantically equivalent. The last write access to occur before ChronoDBTransactionBuilder.build() wins.

        Specified by:
        atTimestamp in interface ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to use for read access. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The builder (this) for method chaining. Never null.

      • onBranch

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder onBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Sets the name of the ChronoDB branch to read in this transaction.

        By default, this value is set to read the master branch (see: ChronoDBConstants.MASTER_BRANCH_IDENTIFIER).

        Specified by:
        onBranch in interface ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Parameters:
        branchName - The name of the branch to connect to. Must not be null. Must refer to an existing branch.
        Returns:
        The builder (this) for method chaining. Never null.

      • withBlindOverwriteProtection

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder withBlindOverwriteProtection(boolean enableBlindOverwriteProtection)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Enables or disables blind overwrite protection on the constructed transaction.

        By default, this value is set to the blind overwrite setting of the ChronoDB instance to which the transaction connects. This method allows to override the database instance defaults for a single transaction.

        Specified by:
        withBlindOverwriteProtection in interface ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Parameters:
        enableBlindOverwriteProtection - Set this to true to enable blind overwrite protection (generally recommended; increased protection against data corruption) or to false in order to disable it (faster; recommended for batch jobs).
        Returns:
        The builder (this) for method chaining. Never null.

      • withDuplicateVersionEliminationMode

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder withDuplicateVersionEliminationMode(DuplicateVersionEliminationMode mode)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Enables or disables duplicate version elimination on the constructed transaction.

        By default, this value is set to the duplicate version elimination setting of the ChronoDB instance to which the transaction connects. This method allows to override the database instance defaults for a single transaction.

        Specified by:
        withDuplicateVersionEliminationMode in interface ChronoDBTransactionBuilder
        Parameters:
        mode - The duplicate version elimination mode to use for this transaction only. Must not be null .
        Returns:
        The builder (this) for method chaining. Never null.
